Tucson had no energy left to fight back.  He could hardly feel Dark Hawk po=
unding on him, as he now goes off line and offers no resistance to his enem=
y's wrath.  Not one sound from him as this happens.  He lands on his side, =
and remains still.  His only hope now was that Rat Trap could get to the Ar=
k.  

Trying to get away from the internal defenses proves difficult to Rat=
 Trap.  With the droids hot on his tail literally, he struggles to scamper =
out of his predicament.

" This is it, I'm a dead rat!  I'm a dead rat!  I'=
M A DEAD RAT! GAHHHH!!!"

Out of sheer panic he slides into a slip hole int=
o a vent shaft.  It proves dark and tight, just big enough for a rat to fit=
 in.  He stays there to catch his breath.

" Sorry Wheels... I ran into a m=
ajor set back..  Maaaaan talk about a mouse trap."  

The transmitter given=
 to him, begins to pulse.  Just a slight faster than before.  Yet still ver=
y far away from his destination, Rat Trap looks to it, and listens to it.

=
" The transmitter.. It's - got somethn'.  Kinda faint but a little bit fast=
er than before..  Which way now?"

With so many droids roaming the halls, i=
t would prove impossible for Rat Trap to continue his journey unseen.  He t=
hinks to himself.

" If I sit here I ain't never gonna get ta the Ark.  And=
 if I don't get ta the ark, those preds'n cons are gonna exploit it for the=
ir own personal gain.  And it looks like Tucson's the key ta gettn' what th=
ey want.  No, I can't just sit here, he's count'n on me.  Dead rat or no de=
ad Rat, I gotta do this."

Slowly and cautiously he ventures out of his hol=
e.

> Tucson reels in pai=
n, and then realizes that Nightlight is not responding to his call. She was=
 unconcious. Again, with every effort he tries to make, his actions once ag=
ain put a major strain on his systems as his energy levels drop from sixty =
to forty percent. This wouldn't bode well for him. He could no longer trans=
form, he could no longer move without great effort. He collapses to the gro=
und, and now hearing Scorponok's steps, he remains up against a wall, burnt=
 out, nearly broken, and severely drained of his resources. His shinny silv=
er armor scuffed and dented, appearing like something out of a major car wr=
eck. He could not go any further. !!
> 
> Rat Trap stands over him and stay=
s by his side.
> 
> "Wheels, no, ya can't give up on me, not like this."
> =

> Tucson puts his hand with effort into Rat Traps'.
> 
> "I - may not be -=
 able to move, but, you - still have all your energy reserves - in tact. Ra=
t - Trap. I - need you to - f- find the others, Zarak mentoned the Ark.. Yo=
u - must find it and - try to get help. Can - you do that?"
> 
> Rat Trap n=
odds.
> 
> " I hate leavn' ya here Wheels, but we're outa options. Okay, I'=
ll do it. For you I'll risk my aft. But, how do I find it? When will I know=
 I've reached it?"
> 
> Tucson gasps for breath. He then takes off his tran=
smitter from his helmet and turns on a beacon. The beacon pulses slowly on =
it. 
> 
> " There is a beacon on this transmitter. The faster it - pulsates=
, the closser you - are to finding the Ark. It was installed on my helmet a=
fter I became visually impaired, so I could find my way back to the Ark aft=
er - each mission. The beacon reacts to the alloys used to build the ship. =
And only ones used by Autobots. 
> 
> Rat Trap takes the transmitter.
> 
> =
"But without this you're a sittn' duck. This is our ears, this is how you n=
avigate. Without this, you'll be bumpn' the walls constantly."
> 
> Tucson =
sighs.
> 
> " I can't go anywhere anyway. Now, get - going. You have a lot =
of ground to cover."
> 
> Rat Trap nodds, while Tucson secures the transmit=
ter onto his left ear, while in his rat form. The transmitter seems rather =
large for his ear yet, he carries it sufficiantly.
> 
> " You can count on =
me Wheels."
> 
> He leaves his disabled friend, and darts out into the hall=
ways in his rat form, cautiously moving and freezing in place once in open =
areas. The transmitter blips slowly. He still had a long way to go before h=
e could reach the Ark.
>
